Question: Can I delete my data?
Answer:
Yes, you can delete your data from Spotify. To do so, you can follow these steps:

1. Go to Your Library on desktop or Your Music on mobile.
2. Scroll down and click/tap on 'See All' under 'Playlists'.
3. Click/tap on the three dots next to a playlist.
4. Select 'Delete'.
5. A dialog box will appear asking if you want to delete the playlist. Click/tap 'OK'. Repeat this process for all your playlists.
6. Go back to Your Library/Your Music and click/tap on 'See All' under 'Songs'.
7. Click/tap on the three dots next to a song.
8. Select 'Remove from library'. Repeat this process for all songs in your library.
9. Delete any other data associated with your account, such as profile information and settings.
10. To delete your account permanently, go to Account Overview > Account Settings > Account Information and click/tap on the 'Close Account' button at the bottom of the page. Note that deleting your account will result in the loss of all data associated with it, including playlists, songs, and any other information stored there.
11. If you have any issues or questions during this process, contact Spotify's Data Protection Officer via email at privacy@spotify.com or by writing to: Spotify USA Inc., 150 Greenwich Street, Floor 62, New York, NY 10007, USA.
